CatDescriptText: Reverend A. Bryant, 1120 Brighton Road, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 16, 1958, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think that Negroes are giving sufficient financial help to the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People?" answer reads: "No, I don't think so. I believe that it requires a lot more money to achieve racial equality."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Reverend A. Bryant, wearing suit jacket with checkered pattern, dark necktie with spiral cross pattern and metal clip with boot charm, moustache, eyeglasses, and light colored hat, holding umbrella, cigarette, and shopping bag, standing in front of brick building, woman wearing dark horizontal striped dress, buildings, and automobiles in background
